paragraphs.content: Chapter 14
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 14

paragraphs.content: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he turned again to the multitude, and did open his mouth unto them again, saying: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Judge not, that ye be not judged.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now it came to pass that when Jesus had spoken these words he turned again to the multitude, and did open his mouth unto them again, saying: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Judge not, that ye be not judged.

paragraphs.content: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.

paragraphs.content: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

paragraphs.content: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the mote out of thine eye—and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother: Let me pull the mote out of thine eye—and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?

paragraphs.content: Thou hypocrite, first cast the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hypocrite, first cast the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote out of thy brother’s eye.

paragraphs.content: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.

paragraphs.content: Ask, and it shall be given unto you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ask, and it shall be given unto you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

paragraphs.content: For every one that asketh, receiveth; and he that seeketh, findeth; and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For every one that asketh, receiveth; and he that seeketh, findeth; and to him that knocketh, it shall be opened.

paragraphs.content: Or what man is there of you, who, if his son ask bread, will give him a stone?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or what man is there of you, who, if his son ask bread, will give him a stone?

paragraphs.content: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

paragraphs.content: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?

paragraphs.content: Therefore, all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them, for this is the law and the prophets.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore, all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them, for this is the law and the prophets.

paragraphs.content: Enter ye in at the strait gate; for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, which leadeth to destruction, and many there be who go in thereat;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Enter ye in at the strait gate; for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, which leadeth to destruction, and many there be who go in thereat;

paragraphs.content: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

paragraphs.content: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

paragraphs.content: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

paragraphs.content: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

paragraphs.content: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

paragraphs.content: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, by their fruits ye shall know them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, by their fruits ye shall know them.

paragraphs.content: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father who is in heaven.

paragraphs.content: Many will say to me in that day: Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name, and in thy name have cast out devils, and in thy name done many wonderful works?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many will say to me in that day: Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name, and in thy name have cast out devils, and in thy name done many wonderful works?

paragraphs.content: And then will I profess unto them: I never knew you; depart from me, ye that work iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And then will I profess unto them: I never knew you; depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

paragraphs.content: Therefore, whoso heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, who built his house upon a rock—
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore, whoso heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, who built his house upon a rock—

paragraphs.content: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not, for it was founded upon a rock.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not, for it was founded upon a rock.

paragraphs.content: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them not shall be likened unto a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand—
paragraphs.contentHtml: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine and doeth them not shall be likened unto a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand—

paragraphs.content: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell, and great was the fall of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell, and great was the fall of it.
